Class Authentication

java.lang.Object
Authentication
public class Authentication extends Object
Authentication handles all security related functionality, including password hashing and user verification. It ensures that sensitive information dealt with in the Accounts class is never stored in plain text.
Since:
2025-11-06

  • Constructor Details

    • Authentication

      public Authentication()
      Constructs a new Authentication object. This default constructor initializes Authentication class (no parameters).

  • Method Details

    • validateCredentials

      public boolean validateCredentials(String username, String password)
      Verifies whether the provided username and password.
      Parameters:
      username - the username entered by the user
      password - the password entered by the user
      Returns:
      true if authentication is successful

    • checkPassword

      public boolean checkPassword(String password)
      Compares a user’s plain-text password to the stored hashed password.
      Parameters:
      password - the plain-text password to compare
      Returns:
      true if the password matches the stored hash

    • checkUsername

      public boolean checkUsername(String username)
      Checks whether a given username exists in the system.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check
      Returns:
      true if the username exists

    • checkSecretAnswer

      public boolean checkSecretAnswer(String username, String answer)
      Validates the secret answer provided by the user during account recovery.
      Parameters:
      username - the username associated with the account
      answer - the plain-text answer entered by the user
      Returns:
      true if the answer matches the stored hash

    • validateUserInfo

      public boolean validateUserInfo(String username, String password, String secretQuestion, String secretAnswer)
      Validates that the provided user information.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to validate
      password - the password to validate
      secretQuestion - the secret question text
      secretAnswer - the secret answer text
      Returns:
      true if all inputs are valid

    • recoverPassword

      public boolean recoverPassword(String username, String newPassword)
      Resets the user’s password after successful identity verification.
      Parameters:
      username - the username associated with the account
      newPassword - the new password to set
      Returns:
      true if the password was successfully reset

    • clearSession

      public void clearSession()
      Clears all in-memory authentication and session data to prevent.

    • hashPassword

      public String hashPassword(String plain)
      Hashes a plain-text password or secret answer.
      Parameters:
      plain - the plain-text string to be hashed
      Returns:
      a hashed version of the input string

    • getSecretQuestion

      public String getSecretQuestion(String username)
      Retrieves the stored secret question for a given username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username associated with the account
      Returns:
      the stored secret question

    • setSecretQuestion

      public boolean setSecretQuestion(String username, String secretQuestion)
      Sets or updates the secret question for a given user.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account
      secretQuestion - the secret question to store
      Returns:
      true if the question is saved successfully

    • setSecretAnswer

      public boolean setSecretAnswer(String username, String secretAnswer)
      Sets or updates the secret answer for a given user.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account
      secretAnswer - the plain-text secret answer to store
      Returns:
      true if the answer is saved successfully
